alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 10:36AM EDT until August 04 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR HICKMAN... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL FULTON COUNTY... At 936 AM CDT, emergency management reported numerous streets remained closed in Hickman due to flash flooding. Water levels are starting to recede, but it will take additional time before the flooding completely subsides. During the last two days, over 11 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Hickman. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hickman. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
